text: Psalm 9
Praise for Yahweh’s Justice

For the \add music\add* director, according to Muth-labben.\f + \fr Ps 9 \ft Meaning uncertain \f* A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 9 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
I will thank Yahweh with all my heart.
I will tell of all your wonderful deeds.
I will be glad and rejoice in you.
I will sing \add the praise of\add* your name, O Most High.
When my enemies turn back,
they will stumble and perish because of your presence.
For you have maintained my just cause;
you have sat on \add the\add* throne judging correctly.
You have rebuked \add the\add* nations;
you have destroyed \add the\add* wicked.
Their name you have blotted out
forever and ever.
The enemies are destroyed \add in\add* ruins forever,
and you have uprooted \add their\add* cities;
their very memory has perished.
But Yahweh sits \add enthroned\add* forever.
He has established his throne for judgment.
And he will judge \add the\add* world with righteousness.
He will judge \add the\add* peoples with equity.
And Yahweh will be a stronghold for the oppressed,
a stronghold in times of distress.
And those who know your name will trust in you,
for you do not forsake those \add who\add* seek you, O Yahweh.
Sing \add praises\add* to Yahweh \add who\add* sits \add enthroned\add*\f + \fr 9:11 \ft Or “who dwells” \f* in Zion.
Tell his deeds among the peoples,
for he \add who\add* ⸤avenges bloodshed⸥\f + \fr 9:12 \ft Literally “seeks bloods” \f* remembers them.
He does not forget the distressed cry of \add the\add* afflicted.
Be gracious to me, O Yahweh.
See my suffering from \add those who\add* hate me,
\add you who\add* lift me up from the gates of death,
so that I may tell of all your praises.
In the gates of the daughter of Zion
let me rejoice in your salvation.
\add The\add* nations have fallen in \add the\add* pit \add that\add* they made;
their foot is caught in \add the\add* net that they hid.
Yahweh has made himself known;
he has executed judgment.
The wicked is snared by the work of his hands. \qs Higgaion\qs*\f + \fr 9:16 \ft Hebrew musical term \f* \qs Selah\qs*
\add The\add* wicked shall turn back to Sheol,
all \add the\add* nations forgetting God,
for \add the\add* needy shall not always be forgotten;
the hope of the poor shall never perish.
Rise up, O Yahweh, let not humans\f + \fr 9:19 \ft Hebrew “human” \f* prevail;
let \add the\add* nations be judged before you.
O Yahweh, put them in fear.
Let \add the\add* nations know they \add are merely\add* human. \qs Selah\qs*
